intro: Tobinia acuminatum, commonly known as the sharp-pointed tobinia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, woody stems and small, palmate leaves with three to five lobes. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. Tobinia acuminatum is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth.
